unnormalised: The Ministry of Silly Walks... err, I mean, the Ministry of Rural Development, has seemingly relocated. A press release states their new address is “B-Wing, 7th Floor, Jeevan Bharti Building, 124, Sansad Marg, New Delhi, 110001.” That’s quite a mouthful! One wonders if the increased administrative efficiency will offset the sheer difficulty of remembering that postal code.
normalised: The Ministry of Silly Walks... err, I mean, the Ministry of Rural Development, has seemingly relocated. A press release states their new address is "B-Wing, seventh Floor, Jeevan Bharti Building, one hundred and twenty four, Sansad Marg, New Delhi, one hundred and ten thousand and one." That's quite a mouthful! One wonders if the increased administrative efficiency will offset the sheer difficulty of remembering that postal code.

unnormalised: Speculation is rife online. Some theorize the move was orchestrated to be closer to Parliament. Others whisper of feng shui consultants and auspicious directions. Still, others suspect a conspiracy involving pigeon racing and strategically placed government buildings. Your guess is as good as mine!
normalised: Speculation is rife online. Some theorize the move was orchestrated to be closer to Parliament. Others whisper of feng shui consultants and auspicious directions. Still, others suspect a conspiracy involving pigeon racing and strategically placed government buildings. Your guess is as good as mine!

unnormalised: The old address, we are told, was at "Krishi Bhavan, Dr. Rajendra Prasad Road, New Delhi - 110001". Seems simple enough. The shift probably caused a chai-break frenzy as babus navigated the new cafeteria situation. One hopes they updated their Google Maps listing; imagine the chaos if someone tries to deliver a vital file to the wrong building.
normalised: The old address, we are told, was at "Krishi Bhavan, Dr. Rajendra Prasad Road, New Delhi - one hundred and ten thousand and one". Seems simple enough. The shift probably caused a chai-break frenzy as babus navigated the new cafeteria situation. One hopes they updated their Google Maps listing; imagine the chaos if someone tries to deliver a vital file to the wrong building.

unnormalised: Ultimately, whether it’s due to aliens, vastu, or simply a better coffee machine, the shift at “124, Sansad Marg” has given us a much-needed dose of bureaucratic whimsy. Now, if only they'd update their website. It still says "Krishi Bhavan"!
normalised: Ultimately, whether it's due to aliens, vastu, or simply a better coffee machine, the shift at "one hundred and twenty four, Sansad Marg" has given us a much-needed dose of bureaucratic whimsy. Now, if only they'd update their website. It still says "Krishi Bhavan"!
